newsitem.title: USA: LVMH close to raising stake in DFS - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: LVMH close to raising stake in DFS - WSJ.

text.p: LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton is close to a pact to buy the minority stake in the DFS Group Ltd chain of duty free shops it does not already own, the Wall Street Journal said.

The paper said people close to the negotiations believe LVMH's talks with Robert Miller, a founder of DFS who has a 38.75 stake in the company, are advanced and a settlement could be reached in a matter of weeks.
LVMH bought 61.25 percent of DFS for about $2.6 billion after concluding a deal with DFS' majority owners last year.
Last week LVMH said it expected the acquisition to have a dilutive effect in 1997 on earnings per share.
